did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Gregory E. Montes urban history and travel collection, 1798-1960.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Travel brochures, city guides, maps, books of views, postcards, and related materials.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Travel brochures, city guides, maps, books of views, postcards, and related materials documenting world cities and tourism in the 19th and 20th centuries. The Montes collection also includes more than 1,000 books (most cataloged separately and searchable in the library catalog) on world cities and urban areas, the majority published between 1798 and 1960.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Gregory E. Montes urban history and travel collection, #8035. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Donated by Gregory E. Montes in memory of Dr. Gustavo E. and Marica S. Montes.

did.unittitle: Series I. Books

scopecontent.p: Only some books are listed here. The majority are available in the library catalog by searching for keywords Gregory Montes.

scopecontent.p: Hand-drawn drafts of First Day covers, often accompanied by feedback, some drafts marked as never used.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous photos

scopecontent.p: Cuba, San Diego, Miscellaneous United States, set of photos by Dominic Caesar including negatives, photos of paintings "New York City Skyline" and "San Diego Skyline" by Sean Selfridge, "Yosemite" by June Rubin

did.unittitle: Artist business cards

scopecontent.p: Business cards produced by artists, either standard 3.5" X 2" or 6" X 4" (with photographs of artwork). Includes: Studio Maha, Bronle Crosby business cards with examples of photography/painting, Jeffery Rule, Inc. Landscape Architecture business card "Bristletone Pine" preview,
